abstract: There is growing speculation that Google is finding it harder than expected to muscle its way into the radio business.
snippet: There is growing speculation that Google is finding it harder than expected to muscle its way into the radio business.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 9  When Google acquired dMarc Broadcasting, a company whose software allows marketers to place ads on radio stations, for up to $1.24 billion early last year, it was seen as a clear sign of Google’s ambitions to extend its dominance over Internet advertising to other media.

headline.main: Google Encounters Hurdles in Selling Radio Advertising
headline.print_headline: Google Encounters Hurdles In Selling Radio Advertising
